clean()[source]ïƒ
get_path(of, pplid=None, args=None)[source]ïƒ

Generate a standardized file path for various experiment artifacts.

Constructs and returns a file path based on the type of file (of), experiment ID, epoch number, and batch index, where applicable. Automatically creates necessary directories if they do not exist.

Parameters:

  • of (str) â€“ The type of file to retrieve the path for. Supported values: - â€œconfigâ€: Configuration file path. - â€œweightâ€: Model weights file path. - â€œgradientâ€: Saved gradients file path. - â€œhistoryâ€: Training history file path. - â€œquickâ€: Quick config file path.

  • pplid (str, optional) â€“ Experiment ID. If not provided, uses the currently set self.pplid.

  • epoch (int, optional) â€“ Epoch number. Required for weight and gradient file paths. For weights, if not specified, the best epoch from config is used.

  • batch (int, optional) â€“ Batch index, required for gradient file paths.

  • args (Dict | None)

Returns:

Full path to the specified artifact as a string with forward slashes.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If pplid is not set or invalid. If required parameters (epoch, batch) are missing for gradient paths. If the of argument is not one of the supported values.

new(pplid=None, args=None, prepare=False)[source]ïƒ

Create a new experiment configuration and initialize its tracking files.

Parameters:

  • pplid (str, optional) â€“ Unique experiment identifier. Raises ValueError if it already exists.

  • args (dict, optional) â€“ Configuration arguments for the experiment.

  • prepare (bool, optional) â€“ If True, calls self.prepare() after creation. Defaults to False.

Raises:

  • ValueError â€“ If the experiment ID already exists or if monitor mode is invalid.

  • KeyError â€“ If â€˜metricsâ€™ key is missing from settings.

  • Behavior â€“

  • -------- â€“

  • - Checks if the experiment ID already exists; raises an error if so. â€“

  • - Checks if the same configuration already exists using verify. â€“

  • - Initializes configuration dictionary with metadata. â€“

  • - Saves the configuration. â€“

  • - Creates an empty history CSV with columns for training and validation metrics and loss. â€“

  • - Initializes quick checkpoint file with default best and last epoch metrics. â€“

  • - Appends experiment metadata to the main experiments CSV. â€“

  • - Optionally calls self.prepare() if prepare=True. â€“

Return type:

None

property pathsïƒ
prepare()[source]ïƒ

Prepare the experiment by loading model, optimizer, metrics, loss, and data loaders.

Loads components according to current configuration, initializes data loaders, and sets the best metric value based on the stored history and strategy.

Raises:

  • ValueError â€“ If strategy monitor mode is not â€˜minâ€™ or â€˜maxâ€™.

  • Behavior â€“

  • -------- â€“

  • - Loads model and moves it to device. â€“

  • - Loads optimizer with model parameters. â€“

  • - Loads metrics and loss functions to device. â€“

  • - Creates training and validation data loaders. â€“

  • - Loads last saved model weights. â€“

  • - Initializes the best metric value from saved checkpoints or sets default. â€“

  • - Sets internal flag _prepared to True on success. â€“

Return type:

None

verify(*, pplid=None, cnfg=None)[source]ïƒ

Check whether a given experiment ID exists in the experiment database.

Queries the experiments table to verify whether the specified experiment ID is recorded.

Parameters:

  • pplid (str) â€“ The experiment ID to check.

  • cnfg (Dict)

Returns:

Returns the pplid if it exists in the database, otherwise returns False.

Return type:

Union[str, bool]

Examples

>>> pipeline.verify("exp_001")
'exp_001'

>>> pipeline.verify("nonexistent_exp")
False
